options.content:
Volume latencies are missing some latencies from NAS protocols. Use the workload volume metrics in the QoS row for a more detailed breakdown.
[Details in ONTAP Performance KB article](https://kb.netapp.com/on-prem/ontap/Perf/Perf-KBs/What_is_the_difference_in_latency_of_the_same_volume_between_statistics_volume_show_and_qos_statistics_volume_latency_show_commands)

Volume latencies are missing some latencies from NAS protocols. Use the workload volume metrics in the QoS row for a more detailed breakdown.
[Details in ONTAP Performance KB article](https://kb.netapp.com/on-prem/ontap/Perf/Perf-KBs/What_is_the_difference_in_latency_of_the_same_volume_between_statistics_volume_show_and_qos_statistics_volume_latency_show_commands)

panels.description: This is the average response time for requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources QoS Volumes by Latency

panels.description: This is the total throughput of data read/write per second from the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources QoS Volumes by Average Throughput

panels.description: This field is the workload's rate of operations that completed during the measurement interval; measured per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources QoS Volumes by Total IOPs

panels.description: This is the average response time for read requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Read Latency

panels.description: This is the average response time for write requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Write Latency

panels.description: This is the rate of this workload's read operations that completed during the measurement interval.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Read IOPS

panels.description: This is the workload's write operations that completed during the measurement interval; measured per second.

panels.description: This is the rate of this workload's other operations that completed during the measurement interval.

panels.description: This is the amount of data read per second from the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Read Throughput

panels.description: This is the amount of data written per second to the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Write Throughput

panels.description: This is the percentage of reads, performed on behalf of the workload, that were sequential.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Sequential Reads

panels.description: This is the percentage of writes, performed on behalf of the workload, that were sequential. This counter is only available on platforms with more than 4GB of NVRAM.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by QoS Volume Sequential Writes
QoS

panels.description: This panel displays the top k volumes with the highest I/O density within the selected time range. I/O density is calculated as the average number of I/O operations (IOPS) per terabyte of logical used space. Volumes with high I/O density are typically more active and may be critical for performance-sensitive applications.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by IO Density (IOPs/TiB)

panels.description: This panel displays the bottom k volumes with the lowest I/O density over the selected time range, excluding any volumes with average IOPS below 50. I/O density is calculated as the average IOPS per terabyte of logical used space. These volumes are active but have relatively low I/O activity compared to their used capacity.
panels.title: Bottom $TopResources Volumes by IO Density (IOPs/TiB)
I/O Density

panels.description: Size that is physically used in the volume, in bytes.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Per Physical Space Used

panels.description: The size that is physically used in the performance tier of the volume and has a cold temperature. This parameter is only supported if the volume is in an aggregate that is either attached to an object store or could be attached to an object store.

Capacity

panels.description: The space that has been set aside as a reserve for Snapshot copy usage, in percent.

panels.description: Percentage of snapshot reserve size that has been used.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Per Snapshot Reserve Used

panels.description: The size (in percent) that is physically used in the performance tier of the volume and has a cold temperature. This parameter is only supported if the volume is in an aggregate that is either attached to an object store or could be attached to an object store.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Inactive Data
Capacity %

options.content: Top clients panels are disabled by default and are supported by the Volume Template in RestPerf Collector starting from ONTAP version 9.13.1. For more details on how to enable them, please refer to the discussion at https://github.com/NetApp/harvest/discussions/3130.

panels.description: This panel displays the top $TopResources volume clients based on their Read IOPs.

panels.description: This panel displays the top $TopResources volume clients based on their write throughput.

options.content: Top files panels are disabled by default and are supported by the Volume Template in RestPerf Collector starting from ONTAP version 9.13.1. For more details on how to enable them, please refer to the discussion at https://github.com/NetApp/harvest/discussions/3130.

panels.description: This panel displays the top $TopResources volume files based on their Read IOPs.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Files by Read IOPs

panels.description: This panel displays the top $TopResources volume files based on their Write IOPs.

panels.description: Average latency per GET operation to object storage.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Object Storage GET Latency

panels.description: Total GET request count, per volume, in the collection interval to object storage.  Not scaled per second, but a cumulative count (delta) since the previous poll.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Object Storage GET Request Count

panels.description: Average latency per PUT operation to object storage.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Object Storage PUT Latency

panels.description: Total PUT request count, per volume, in the collection interval to object storage.  Not scaled per second, but a cumulative count (delta) since the previous poll.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Object Storage PUT Request Count

panels.description: Average request count, per volume, in the chosen time window, to object storage.  Not scaled per second, but a cumulative count (delta) since the previous poll.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Object Storage Requests
Object Storage

panels.description: Display a list of volumes and metadata footprints in their associated aggregate.

targets.expr: volume_delayed_free_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_metadata_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_total_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_total_metadata_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_guarantee_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_performance_tier_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}
volume_capacity_tier_footprint{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",style!="flexgroup_constituent",svm=~"$SVM",volume=~"$Volume"}

panels.title: Volumes Footprint

panels.description: Footprint of blocks written to the volume in bytes for the performance tier (bin 0).
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Performance Tier Footprint

panels.description: Footprint of blocks written to the volume in performance tier (bin 0) as a percentage of aggregate size.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Performance Tier Footprint %

panels.description: Footprint of blocks written to the volume in bytes for capacity tier (bin 1).
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Capacity Tier Footprint

panels.description: Footprint of blocks written to the volume in capacity tier (bin 1) as a percentage of aggregate size.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Capacity Tier Footprint %

panels.description: This field represents the delayed free blocks footprint. This is used to improve delete performance by batching delete requests.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Delayed Free Footprint

panels.description: This represents flexible metadata for a volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Metadata Footprint

panels.description: Volume total footprint.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Total Footprint

panels.description: Total metadata footprint for a volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Total Metadata Footprint

panels.description: This field represents the volume guarantee footprint. Alternatively, it is the space reserved for future writes in the volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Capacity Tier Footprint
FabricPool

panels.description: Number of user-visible files (inodes) used. This field is valid only when the volume is online.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Inode Files Used

panels.description: Total user-visible file (inode) count, i.e., current maximum number of user-visible files (inodes) that this volume can currently hold.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Inode Files Total

panels.description: volume_inode_files_used / volume_inode_total.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Inode Files Used Percentage
Inode

options.content:
This panel requires ONTAP 9.12+ and the APIs are only available via REST. Enable the REST collector in your `harvest.yml` config.
See https://github.com/NetApp/harvest/wiki/Troubleshooting-Harvest#why-do-i-have-volume-sis-stat-panel-empty-in-volume-dashboard for more details.

panels.description: Percent of compress fail.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Number of Compress Fail %
Top $TopResources Volumes by Number of Compress Attempts
Top $TopResources Volumes by Number of Compress Fail
Sis Stat

panels.description: Physical space used growth rate per second in the volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Per Growth Rate of Physical Used

panels.description: Logical space used growth rate per second in the volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Per Growth Rate of Logical Used

panels.description:
This panel tracks changes in the physical usage space of the top $TopResources volumes by physical space. It includes the following delta columns:

- **1-Day Delta:** This column shows the change in physical usage space over the past 24 hours. 
  
- **7-Day Delta:** This column displays the change in physical usage space over the past 7 days.
  
- **Time Range Delta:** This column reflects the change in physical usage space over the selected time range in the Grafana dashboard.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Physical Usage: Delta

panels.description:
This panel tracks changes in the logical usage space of the top $TopResources volumes by logical space. It includes the following delta columns:

- **1-Day Delta:** This column shows the change in logical usage space over the past 24 hours. 
  
- **7-Day Delta:** This column displays the change in logical usage space over the past 7 days.
  
- **Time Range Delta:** This column reflects the change in logical usage space over the selected time range in the Grafana dashboard.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Logical Usage: Delta
Growth Rate

panels.description: This table would show 15 day predicted value of size used percentage for top volumes.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes Per Size Used Percentage Trend
Forecast Volume Capacity
